level-up.name: wing-attack
level-up.description:
The target is struck with large, imposing wings
spread wide to inflict damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: rock-throw
level-up.description:
The user picks up and throws a small rock at the
target to attack.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: double-team
level-up.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

level-up.name: scary-face
level-up.description:
The user frightens the target with a scary face to
harshly lower its Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: pluck
level-up.description:
The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a
Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

level-up.name: ancient-power
level-up.description:
The user attacks with a prehistoric power.
This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: quick-guard
level-up.description:
The user protects itself and its allies from
priority moves.
level-up.effect:
Moves with priority greater than 0 will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: acrobatics
level-up.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

level-up.name: dragon-breath
level-up.description:
The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: endeavor
level-up.description:
This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal
the user’s HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

level-up.name: u-turn
level-up.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

level-up.name: rock-slide
level-up.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: dragon-claw
level-up.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: thrash
level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.name: bite
egg.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: steel-wing
egg.description:
The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also
raise the user’s Defense stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

egg.name: knock-off
egg.description:
The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that
item can’t be used in that battle. The move does
more damage if the target has a held item.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

egg.name: dragon-pulse
egg.description:
The target is attacked with a shock wave generated
by the user’s gaping mouth.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: earth-power
egg.description:
The user makes the ground under the target erupt
with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

egg.name: defog
egg.description:
A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such
as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the
target’s evasiveness.
egg.effect:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth rock, and toxic spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

egg.name: head-smash
egg.description:
The user attacks the target with a hazardous,
full-power headbutt. This also damages the
user terribly.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/2 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: snore
tutor.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
tutor.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: sleep-talk
tutor.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
tutor.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

tutor.name: iron-tail
tutor.description:
The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: uproar
tutor.description:
The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.
During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for 2–5 turns, selected at random.  All Pokémon on the field wake up, and none can fall to sleep until the lock-in ends.

Pokémon cannot use rest during this effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

tutor.name: heat-wave
tutor.description:
The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing
Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with
a burn.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

tutor.name: endeavor
tutor.description:
This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal
the user’s HP.
tutor.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

tutor.name: iron-defense
tutor.description:
The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,
sharply raising its Defense stat.
tutor.effect: Raises the user's Defense by two stages.

tutor.name: bounce
tutor.description:
The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
tutor.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User bounces high into the air for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

During the immune turn, gust, hurricane, sky uppercut, smack down, thunder, and twister still hit the user normally.  gust and twister also have double power against the user.

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be used while gravity is in effect.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

tutor.name: roost
tutor.description:
The user lands and rests its body. This move restores
the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
tutor.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

tutor.name: tailwind
tutor.description:
The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups
the Speed stats of the user and its allies for
four turns.
tutor.effect: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.

tutor.name: aqua-tail
tutor.description:
The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a
vicious wave in a raging storm.

tutor.name: dragon-pulse
tutor.description:
The target is attacked with a shock wave generated
by the user’s gaping mouth.

tutor.name: earth-power
tutor.description:
The user makes the ground under the target erupt
with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

tutor.name: stealth-rock
tutor.description:
The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the
opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon
that switch into battle.
tutor.effect:
Spreads sharp rocks around the opposing field, damaging any Pokémon that enters the field for 1/8 its max HP.  This damage is affected by the entering Pokémon's susceptibility to rock moves.

rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.

machine.name: cut
machine.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: hone-claws
machine.description:
The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat
and accuracy.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: dragon-claw
machine.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: smack-down
machine.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile to
attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the
ground when it’s hit.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sandstorm
machine.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: aerial-ace
machine.description:
The user confounds the target with speed, then
slashes. This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: torment
machine.description:
The user torments and enrages the target, making it
incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
machine.effect:
Prevents the target from attempting to use the same move twice in a row.  When the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If the target is forced to attempt a repeated move due to choice band, choice scarf, choice specs, disable, encore, taunt, only having PP remaining for one move, or any other effect, the target will use struggle instead.  The target is then free to use the forced move next turn, as it didn't use that move this turn.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: acrobatics
machine.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

machine.name: shadow-claw
machine.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made from
shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: rock-polish
machine.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This sharply raises the Speed stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: stone-edge
machine.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: bulldoze
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: pluck
machine.description:
The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a
Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: wing-attack
level-up.description:
The target is struck with large, imposing wings
spread wide to inflict damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.description:
The user picks up and throws a small rock at the
target to attack.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

harshly lower its Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a
Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
level-up.effect:

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

The user attacks with a prehistoric power.
This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

The user relaxes and lightens its body to move

level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: quick-guard
level-up.description:
The user protects itself and its allies from
priority moves.
level-up.effect:
Moves with priority greater than 0 will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: acrobatics
level-up.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

level-up.name: dragon-breath
level-up.description:
The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: endeavor
level-up.description:
This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal
the user’s HP.
level-up.effect: Inflicts exactly enough damage to lower the target's HP to equal the user's.  If the target's HP is not higher than the user's, this move has no effect.  Type immunity applies, but other type effects are ignored.  This effect counts as damage for moves that respond to damage.

level-up.name: u-turn
level-up.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

level-up.name: rock-slide
level-up.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.name: dragon-claw
level-up.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: thrash
level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.name: bite
egg.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: steel-wing
egg.description:
The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also
raise the user’s Defense stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

egg.name: knock-off
egg.description:
The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that
item can’t be used in that battle. The move does
more damage if the target has a held item.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Target loses its held item.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

If the target has multitype or sticky hold, it will take damage but not lose its item.

egg.name: dragon-pulse
egg.description:
The target is attacked with a shock wave generated
by the user’s gaping mouth.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: earth-power
egg.description:
The user makes the ground under the target erupt
with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

egg.name: switcheroo
egg.description:
The user trades held items with the target faster
than the eye can follow.
egg.effect:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice band, choice scarf, or choice specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: defog
egg.description:
A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such
as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the
target’s evasiveness.
egg.effect:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth rock, and toxic spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

egg.name: head-smash
egg.description:
The user attacks the target with a hazardous,
full-power headbutt. This also damages the
user terribly.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/2 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: ally-switch
egg.description:
The user teleports using a strange power and
switches places with one of its allies.
egg.effect: User switches position on the field with the friendly Pokémon opposite it.  If the user is in the middle position in a triple battle, or there are no other friendly Pokémon, this move will fail.

machine.name: cut
machine.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: hone-claws
machine.description:
The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat
and accuracy.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Attack and accuracy by one stage.

machine.name: dragon-claw
machine.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: roost
machine.description:
The user lands and rests its body. This move restores
the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
machine.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: smack-down
machine.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile to
attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the
ground when it’s hit.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: dig
machine.description:
The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on
the next turn.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock on, mind reader, or no guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep talk.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sandstorm
machine.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: aerial-ace
machine.description:
The user confounds the target with speed, then
slashes. This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: torment
machine.description:
The user torments and enrages the target, making it
incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
machine.effect:
Prevents the target from attempting to use the same move twice in a row.  When the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If the target is forced to attempt a repeated move due to choice band, choice scarf, choice specs, disable, encore, taunt, only having PP remaining for one move, or any other effect, the target will use struggle instead.  The target is then free to use the forced move next turn, as it didn't use that move this turn.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: steel-wing
machine.description:
The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also
raise the user’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

machine.name: acrobatics
machine.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

machine.name: shadow-claw
machine.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made from
shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: rock-polish
machine.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This sharply raises the Speed stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: stone-edge
machine.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: bulldoze
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: rock-smash
machine.description:
The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower
the target’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: wing-attack
level-up.description:
The target is struck with large, imposing wings
spread wide to inflict damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: leer
level-up.description:
The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating
leer that lowers the Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: quick-attack
level-up.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: rock-throw
level-up.description:
The user picks up and throws a small rock at the
target to attack.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: double-team
level-up.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

level-up.name: scary-face
level-up.description:
The user frightens the target with a scary face to
harshly lower its Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: pluck
level-up.description:
The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a
Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca berry or rowap berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

level-up.name: ancient-power
level-up.description:
The user attacks with a prehistoric power.
This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

level-up.name: agility
level-up.description:
The user relaxes and lightens its body to move
faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

level-up.name: quick-guard
level-up.description:
The user protects itself and its allies from
priority moves.
level-up.effect:
Moves with priority greater than 0 will not hit friendly Pokémon for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: acrobatics
level-up.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

level-up.name: dragon-breath
level-up.description:
The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage.
This may also leave the target with paralysis.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

level-up.name: crunch
level-up.description:
The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.
This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

the user’s HP.

If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

level-up.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.description:
The user rampages and attacks for two to three
turns. The user then becomes confused.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to attack with this move for 2–3 turns,selected at random.  After the last hit, the user becomes confused.

safeguard does not protect against the confusion from this move.

egg.description:
The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs.
This may also make the target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also

egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

egg.effect:

The target is attacked with a shock wave generated
by the user’s gaping mouth.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

with power. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

The user trades held items with the target faster

egg.effect:
User and target permanently swap held items.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

egg.effect:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth rock, and toxic spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

egg.name: head-smash
egg.description:
The user attacks the target with a hazardous,
full-power headbutt. This also damages the
user terribly.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/2 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: ally-switch
egg.description:
The user teleports using a strange power and
switches places with one of its allies.
egg.effect: User switches position on the field with the friendly Pokémon opposite it.  If the user is in the middle position in a triple battle, or there are no other friendly Pokémon, this move will fail.

machine.name: dragon-claw
machine.description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: roar
machine.description:
The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is
dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a
single Pokémon.
machine.effect:
Switches the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: roost
machine.description:
The user lands and rests its body. This move restores
the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
machine.effect: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: smack-down
machine.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile to
attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the
ground when it’s hit.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Removes the target's immunity to ground-type damage.  This effect removes any existing Ground immunity due to levitate, magnet rise, or telekinesis, and causes the target's flying type to be ignored when it takes Ground damage.

If the target isn't immune to Ground damage, this move will fail.

This move can hit Pokémon under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky drop, and ends the effect of Bounce or Fly.

machine.name: earthquake
machine.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every
Pokémon around it.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sandstorm
machine.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all
combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to a sandstorm for five turns.  Pokémon that are not ground, rock, or steel take 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.  Every rock Pokémon's original Special Defense is raised by 50% for the duration of this effect.

solar beam's power is halved.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis only heal 1/4 the user's max HP.

machine.name: rock-tomb
machine.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers
the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: aerial-ace
machine.description:
The user confounds the target with speed, then
slashes. This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: torment
machine.description:
The user torments and enrages the target, making it
incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
machine.effect:
Prevents the target from attempting to use the same move twice in a row.  When the target leaves the field, this effect ends.

If the target is forced to attempt a repeated move due to choice band, choice scarf, choice specs, disable, encore, taunt, only having PP remaining for one move, or any other effect, the target will use struggle instead.  The target is then free to use the forced move next turn, as it didn't use that move this turn.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: steel-wing
machine.description:
The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also
raise the user’s Defense stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense one stage.

machine.name: acrobatics
machine.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not
holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

machine.name: shadow-claw
machine.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw made from
shadows. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: rock-polish
machine.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This sharply raises the Speed stat.
machine.effect: Raises the user's Speed by two stages.

machine.name: stone-edge
machine.description:
The user stabs the target from below with
sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: bulldoze
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by stomping
down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of
those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: rock-slide
machine.description:
Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to
inflict damage. This may also make the opposing
Pokémon flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: u-turn
machine.description:
After making its attack, the user rushes back to
switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faints from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
